name: SeatGeek PRD Template
description: Direct questions to: [product owner] or [#project-slack-channel] Last updated: [MMM DD YYYY]

sections.title: **What**
sections.content: Describe the initiative. Keep it high level and use plain language.

sections.title: **Why**
sections.content: Why should we work on this? Include how it aligns with business and user goals.

sections.title: **Success Criteria**
sections.content:
What does success look like? Include quant and qual metrics as appropriate.

| **Metric** | **Baseline (Date)** | **Target (Date)** | **Latest (Updated On)** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  |  |  |  |

sections.content:
### [Date] - [Description]

- *Add agenda, notes, action item*

# **Product Spec**

*This section gives us a consistent way of making sure we‚Äôre working on the right problems before diving into solutions.*

sections.title: **Alignment**
sections.content: How does this initiative tie to broader team or company goals and strategies?

sections.title: **Key Insights and Inspiration**
sections.content: What key insights (quant or qual) and inspiration (including competitive research) should be considered when refining the problem and exploring solutions? Please add any related links or dashboards.

sections.title: **Problem Statement**
sections.content: What‚Äôs the underlying problem we‚Äôve observed? How do we know this is true?

sections.title: **Hypothesis & Impact**
sections.content: We believe [capability], will lead to [outcome], which will result in [metric change] by [date]. Include guesses for the size of the win.

sections.title: **Constraints**
sections.content: What are the key constraints, deadlines, or hard requirements to consider?

sections.title: **Non-Goals**
sections.content:
Are there any related problems that we want to explicitly ignore for now?

# **Design Exploration**

*This section helps us ensure a collaborative and divergent design process. It also helps us document previously considered directions and rationales for large design decisions.*

üîó Figma Link

sections.title: **Initial Ideas**
sections.content:
Document any initial ideas or user stories that should be considered when exploring solutions.

| **Ideas** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| [Idea Name] | [Add brief description and any supporting links] |

| **User Stories** | **Importance** |
| --- | --- |
| As a [persona], I [want to], [so that] | **Must have¬† Nice to have¬† Optional** |

sections.title: **Explored Directions**
sections.content:
Document the main directions being considered, along with links to the design artifacts.

| **Name** | **Details** |
| --- | --- |
| [Direction Name] | [Short description w/ link to details] |

sections.title: **Key Decisions**
sections.content: Document any key decisions that were made.

sections.title: **Decided Direction**
sections.content:
Describe which direction was chosen to move forward with and why it was chosen.


**View Original Template:** [Adam Waxman (SeatGeek) PRD template](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xc9TZX-7NMfOykzFKR0o0jzTUygoAFzWadxDVR7sNvs/edit?usp=sharing)
